Entries.default: "Hey! You! Over here!"
"Ah, feels good to stretch my legs, ekera."
"You, friend - you will let will me from this cage, yes?"
"Free once again!"
"What are you doing in here?"
"Who are you?"
[Leave] "I don't want to get involved."
"How'd you get captured in the first place?"
"So, about my reward..."
"What if I combine... No, not that. Maybe... No, not that either."
"How do I get you out?"
"Find the key, I say! Surely one of those witches has it!"
"You have eyes, friend? I am held prisoner!"
"Tama Watua! Famed apothecary, favored prize of pirates, and all that. Ah, you have heard of me, yes? Of course you have."
[Leave] "I'll be back with the key."
"No, wait! Please! Do not leave me here!"
"Hurry, friend, hurry! I cannot stand another moment in here."
[Leave] "I'll be on my way."

"Bad luck, eh? Always this seems to happen to me! First pirates, now witches.

"All for what, a salve recipe? It is madness."
"You have the witches' notes? I will translate them for you as a show of thanks, ekera."
"Thank you again, my friend. You ever need a salve or potion, you come to Tama, eh? I will see you right."
"There is not much I might give you, I am afraid... Ah, but wait! The witches, they made many notes regarding the contents of their cauldron."
"What do you have for sale?"
"You take a look, eh?"
"Do you know what the witches were brewing in that cauldron?"
"Eh, what potion requires bat bile, cat blood, and dandelion fluff? Even I am not crazy enough to touch it, I say!"

"You ain't never quaffed brewed bat bile, cap? Then you ain't even lived."

Serafen chuckles quietly.
"I've already deciphered the notes, actually."

"Did you? I must say, friend, I am most impressed! Yes, hm, I should like to take you as my apprentice, but ah, I haven't the time. You understand, I'm sure." He chews on a knuckle, thinking, then straightens with a smile.
"I should know - they would not feed me unless I gave them advice on the concoction. Peh, fools." He spits on the floor and shakes his head bitterly.
"Bring me their notes, friend, and I will decipher them for you, yes? Then you may make use of their potion without danger." He nods vigorously.
"Please, take this coin. I know it is not much, but I have naught else to offer you, and you have saved my life."
"Disgusting. Why can't potions ever be made of more pleasant ingredients?"
"Though I'm sure if Zahua were here, he'd have already snorted or smoked half of that cauldron."
"You're not leaving? But I just freed you!"
"Ekera, who do you think collected those ingredients for the witches? Me! Tama Watua! They are mine as much as anyone's, I say."
"I will take some time to study this island, I think. Strange things grow among its weeds, and they will need names."
"And if you need supplies before you go, Tama will sell you what he can find, ekera." He dips his head in graceful acknowledgment.
